page.title: 04Road to Rhenigidale.
page.content: The village of Rhenigidale is surrounded by hills rising at the highest point to{TODDUN}528m. The primary land cover is uncultivated non-woodland vegetation. There are also extensive peat areas. The villagers make a living by part time employment and crofting. Sheep are kept and this is the main source of income. Some crops are grown for the crofters and animals own use. For many years the villagers have been campaigning for an access road to the village. The isolation makes life here very difficult but the villagers were determined to stay. This year work has finally begun on the first phase of a road in from Maaruig. This phase, covering 2 miles will be of a high standard and will cost the{Western {Isles Islands Council}Â£500,000 but it is worth every penny to the villagers.
